docs.title: Welcome to Ka-Doe Documentation
docs.text: Welcome! This site provides detailed guides, and information on how to use Ka-Doe.

docs.title: About Ka-Doe
docs.text:
Ka-Doe is more than just code — it's the soft-pawed tabby whose whispers calmed the chaos, whose eyes sparked brilliance in the blaze. Born from a blend of quiet strength, thoughtful design, and bold devotion, Ka-Doe offers a graceful yet powerful solution for document parsing and previewing.

Whether you're building tools for document automation or integrating AI into your pipelines, Ka-Doe aims to make the process simple, elegant, and customizable.

docs.title: 🔍 Project Goals
docs.text:
Our primary goals with Ka-Doe:

  • 🐾 Ease of Use – Simple setup, clear documentation, and intuitive API design.
  • 🧩 Customizable Architecture – Modular components to fit a variety of use cases.
  • 🧾 Reliable Documentation – Developer-first docs for smooth onboarding and maintenance.

docs.title: 💡 Technologies Used
docs.text:
Ka-Doe is built using:

  • 🐍 Python 3.12+ – The core language powering the backend.
  • 📦 FastAPI – For fast, clean, asynchronous web APIs.
  • 🐱 PurrfectKit – A utility library tailored for Ka-Doe’s internal processing.
  • 🔍 Tesseract OCR – For text extraction from images and PDFs.
  • 📄 Poppler – To support advanced PDF manipulation.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Welcome to Ka-Doe 🐾 — let’s get your environment up and running!

This guide walks you through the installation steps, runtime requirements, and how to launch the API locally.

docs.title: 🛠 Requirements
docs.text:
Before you begin, ensure the following dependencies are installed:

  • Python 3.12.4 – Core language runtime
  • Tesseract OCR – For image-based text extraction
  • Poppler – For PDF parsing and rendering
  • PurrfectKit – Utility toolkit powering internal workflows

docs.title: 1. System Dependencies
docs.text:
Install the required system packages:

sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install \
  tesseract-ocr \
  tesseract-ocr-tha \
  poppler-utils \
  ffmpeg \
  libmagic1

docs.title: 2. Python Packages
docs.text:
Install the Python dependencies using pip:

pip install fastapi uvicorn python-multipart \
    git+https://github.com/suwalutions/PurrfectKit.git@meow

docs.title: 🚦 Run the Application
docs.text:
Once everything is installed, start the Ka-Doe server with:

uvicorn main:app

Your API will be available at:

👉 http://127.0.0.1:8000/docs

This endpoint provides an interactive Swagger UI for exploring the API.

docs.text: Check the Project Structure for more insights, or visit the API Reference for usage examples.

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text:
Here’s a breakdown of Ka-Doe’s directory layout:

.
├── main.py # Entrypoint for the FastAPI app
├── api/ # Application logic
│ ├── helpers.py # Helper functions
│ ├── models.py # Data models
│ ├── loggings.py # Logging config
│ └── routes/ # API endpoints
│ └── v1/ # Version 1 routes
├── docs/ # MkDocs documentation
├── dockers/ # Docker and Compose files
├── requirements.txt # Python dependencies
├── settings.json # Editor settings
└── mkdocs.yml # MkDocs config
